meanings.sent1: The poet used an iambic rhythm in his verses.
meanings.sent2: Her iambic style of writing made the poem flow smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The iambic pattern in the song made it easy to dance to.
meanings.sent4: His iambic speech was like a gentle heartbeat, calming the audience.
meanings.sent5: The iambic nature of the music created a soothing melody.

meanings.definition: A metrical foot consisting of one short syllable followed by one long syllable.
meanings.sent1: The iambic in the poem added a musical quality to the lines.
meanings.sent2: She studied the iambic in literature class.
meanings.sent3: The iambic in the play made the audience tap their feet unconsciously.
meanings.sent4: His heartbeat matched the iambic of the drumming rain outside.
meanings.sent5: The iambic of the waves crashing on the shore was mesmerizing.
